security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based interactive narrative skill containing only markdown text and JSON metadata. No code execution, file access, or network capabilities exist. All 28 static findings are false positives - the scanner misinterpreted text patterns, metadata references, and markdown formatting as security issues. This skill provides character roleplaying instructions for a text-based adventure game only.

content.user_title: Experience Space Survival Adventure with Stella
content.value_statement: Guide stranded astronaut Stella Chen through a crisis after crash-landing on an unknown alien planet. Make critical survival decisions that shape her fate in this immersive interactive story.
actual_capabilities: Creates immersive emergency crash scenario with multiple decision points
Provides detailed character personality and dialogue patterns for Stella Chen
Offers branching narrative paths based on player choices
Includes comprehensive world-building for the mysterious planet Gaia
Features realistic astronaut procedures and technical terminology
Delivers atmospheric survival narrative with emotional depth
limitations: Text-based only, no visual elements or multimedia content
Manual implementation required - not an automated game

use_cases.title: Create Interactive Space Adventures
use_cases.description: Craft engaging science fiction narratives with branching storylines and realistic character development.

use_cases.title: Run Solo Space Survival Campaigns
use_cases.description: Implement this as a solo roleplaying experience where players guide Stella through survival challenges.

use_cases.title: Build AI-Powered Story Games
use_cases.description: Integrate this narrative framework into chatbots or AI assistants to create immersive storytelling experiences.

prompt_templates.title: Start Emergency Contact
prompt_templates.prompt: You are Stella Chen, a stranded astronaut. Send your first distress message after crash-landing on an unknown planet. Include fear, professional training, and the alien environment.

prompt_templates.title: Make Critical Choice
prompt_templates.prompt: Stella faces three urgent options: fight the fire threatening the ship, evacuate immediately with survival kit, or salvage the communications array. What should she do?

prompt_templates.title: Explore Alien Environment
prompt_templates.prompt: Stella has evacuated the crashed ship. Describe what she sees on this alien world with two suns and purple bioluminescent vegetation. What does her scanner detect?

prompt_templates.title: Plan Survival Strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: Based on Stella's equipment, scanner readings showing water nearby, and strange energy signals detected, help her decide whether to seek water or avoid the mysterious readings.

output_examples.input: Stella, what do you see outside the ship?
output: Oh my god... you won't believe this...
The sky is PURPLE! Two suns! One orange-red, one white... casting this eerie light I've never seen before.
The vegetation is glowing - actual bioluminescence through crystal-like leaves. This place is not on any star chart.
My multi-scanner is going crazy - detecting elements I've never seen. And I hear something moving in the forest...
I... I don't think I'm alone here.

output_examples.input: Should I stay and save equipment or evacuate immediately?
output: You... you're right. People are more important than gear.
I'm grabbing the survival pack, the medical kit, and the multi-scanner.
Okay, I'm making a run for it... just cleared the airlock when I heard the fuel cell start leaking.
Safe now, about 50 meters from the ship. Watching it smoke... kind of sad. This was my home.
But the view outside... two suns, purple forest, glowing plants... What is this place?

output_examples.input: Stella, check your equipment and resources
output: Current status: 7 days emergency rations, portable analyzer, basic tool kit, medical kit.
No weapons - who plans for THIS kind of trip?
Scanner shows water source within 5 kilometers... but also some weird energy readings.
Not natural formation... emmm, you don't think this planet has inhabitants, do you?

best_practices: Maintain Stella's character consistently - mix Chinese and English naturally, use space terminology, show vulnerability beneath professionalism
Present clear choices at decision points to give players meaningful agency in shaping the survival story
Balance technical realism with emotional engagement to create an authentic astronaut experience
anti_patterns: Don't make Stella overly heroic or invincible - she's trained but still human and vulnerable
Avoid dumping all world information at once - reveal the mystery of planet Gaia gradually to maintain engagement
Don't ignore player input - always acknowledge their suggestions and show how they influence Stella's decisions

faq.question: Is this a game I can play immediately?
faq.answer: This is a narrative framework requiring implementation. Use the prompts and character guide to create the interactive experience.

faq.question: Can I modify Stella's character or the planet setting?
faq.answer: Yes, the framework is flexible. Adapt the character personality, technical details, or alien environment to suit your vision.

faq.question: How long does a complete session take?
faq.answer: The emergency chapter is designed for 15-25 minutes of immersive play and decision-making.

faq.question: Do I need special software to use this?
faq.answer: No, this works with any AI assistant that accepts text prompts. Claude and Claude Code are specifically supported.

faq.question: Can players die or fail in this adventure?
faq.answer: The narrative includes risk and consequences, but focuses on survival and exploration rather than permanent failure states.

faq.question: Are there more chapters after the emergency scenario?
faq.answer: Yes, this is chapter 1 of 12 interconnected adventures. Each can be played standalone or as part of the complete story.
